intro: Psacalium pinetorum, commonly known as the pine forest morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soil, often found in woodland edges and open forests. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with climbing or trailing growth habits. Psacalium pinetorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
